result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to any sentence def is currently serving.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with all Summit Credit Unions, Wipp Brothers Ag Services Dane, WI, JW or ED. Not possess or consume any illegal drugs. Not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Maintain stable residence. Participate with the DOC electronic monitoring program as deemed appropriate by DOC agent. Completion of Compas needs assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA testing at the request of DOC agent or any treatment provider. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: Due to def's successful completion of the Earned Release Program on 4/7/17, court ordered DOC to effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; counsel offer agrement for plea and request a PSI; Ct conducts colloquy with defn defn pleads guilty to ct 1; Ct adjudicates defn guilty; bail revoked; Ct orders PSI; Ct will send notice for SEH; Ct adjourned.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Emmanuel D.
- Defendant shall not be on the physical grounds of any bank or credit union.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.

Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
